using the controls here:

https://skia.googlesource.com/buildbot/+doc/main/autoroll/README.md
author: engine-flutter-autoroll

title: [shared_preferences] let the new "with cache" and "async" APIs expose proper testing utils
body:

### What target platforms are you seeing this bug on?

N.A.

Yes

  dart: ">=3.8.1 <4.0.0"
  flutter: ">=3.27.0"
```

</details>


### Steps to reproduce

Try to write a test that involves e.g. `SharedPreferencesWithCache`

### Expected results

I'd expect the APIs to offer something similar to what the legacy API do, e.g. `SharedPreferences.setMockInitialValues`.
Or, alternatively, a way to set the underlying platform to `.inMemory` (similarly to [this](https://github.com/flutter/packages/blob/1642c3a66759a5388caefc9b5dc38691f3fa5098/packages/shared_preferences/shared_preferences/test/shared_preferences_async_test.dart#L670)).

### Actual results
I tried using the old `.setMockInitialValues` and then opening a `SharedPreferencesWithCache` instance, but this leads to
```
Bad state: The SharedPreferencesAsyncPlatform instance must be set.
```
... as there's no way to access those APIs for me!

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import "package:flutter_test/flutter_test.dart";
import "package:shared_preferences/shared_preferences.dart";

void main() {
  setUp(() {
    SharedPreferences.setMockInitialValues({});
  });
  test("let folks mock the new shared prefs apis", () {
    final prefs = SharedPreferencesWithCache.create(
      cacheOptions: const SharedPreferencesWithCacheOptions(),
    );
    expectLater(prefs, completes);
  });
}
```

</details>


### Screenshots or Videos

N.A.

### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

```console
Bad state: The SharedPreferencesAsyncPlatform instance must be set.
package:shared_preferences/src/shared_preferences_async.dart 25:7    new SharedPreferencesAsync
package:shared_preferences/src/shared_preferences_async.dart 184:13  new SharedPreferencesWithCache._create
package:shared_preferences/src/shared_preferences_async.dart 196:36  SharedPreferencesWithCache.create
test/sp_test.dart 9:46                                               main.<fn>
===== asynchronous gap ===========================
dart:async                                                           Future._asyncCompleteError
test/sp_test.dart 9:46                                               main.<fn>
```

</details>

<details open><summary>Doctor output</summary>

```console
% flutter doctor
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 3.32.8, on macOS 15.6.1 24G90 darwin-arm64, locale en-IT)

[✓] Android Studio (version 2024.2)
[✓] VS Code (version 1.103.2)
[✓] Connected device (2 available)
[✓] Network resources

• No issues found!
```

</details>

title: Flutter generates dependency aar with version of their parent instead of version of the dependency
body: ## Steps to Reproduce ``` flutter create -t module --org com.example.a library_a cd library_a flutter pub add android_intent_plus flutter build aar cd .. flutter create -t module --org com.example.b library_b cd library_a flutter pub add android_intent_plus // Open pubspec.yaml and change android_intent_plus to 1.0.1 flutter build aar --build-number=2.0 ``` Add library aars to an android project (I used a new android project) You can find Gradle scan here https://scans.gradle.com/s/k2kgkmqjntcay android_intent_plus versions are the same as the root library version. 1.0 and 2.0. Library_b overrides the library_a's android_intent_plus dependency because 2.0 is higher than 1.0. But in reality, library_b should have a lower version with 1.0.1 and library_a should have android_intent_plus with version 3.1.5. (or the latest version of android_intent_plus) Previously reported issue. https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/115732 Please find flutter projects here. [Archive.zip](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/files/10264072/Archive.zip) - Open the zip, and build projects as described. - library_a -> flutter build aar --build-number=1.0 - library_b -> flutter build aar --build-number=2.0 - Integrate libraries into a new android project Build the project. The project will fail with the following error -> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/74857653/adding-multiple-flutter-library-modules-fails-build-with-duplicate-class. Build with multiple flutter projects should also compile without problem but the build fail is a different case. This issue is intended to manifest the library version issue. As seen in the screenshot, library_a and library_b brings android_intent_plus with their own versions instead of 1.0.1 and 3.1.5. built aar files' pom have following dependencies. library_a ``` io.flutter.plugins.androidintent android_intent_plus 1.0 compile ``` library_a ``` io.flutter.plugins.androidintent android_intent_plus 2.0 compile ``` # Expected behaviour - library_a should request android_intent_plus with 3.1.5 - library_b should request android_intent_plus with 1.0.1 when they added to a grade build.

title: [flutter_migrate] Unit tests are too slow
body: Essentially all other packages have unit tests that run in less than a minute; flutter_migrate is doing something more like integration tests, and the tests take 10 minutes. We should look into slimming them down; that's way too long for unit tests to take, and is causing some timeout issues in certain cases.

title: animate cupertino time picker hour label
body:
This PR adds the `buildAnimatedLabel` function to the CupertinoTimePicker widget, allowing the creation of a label with a FadeTransition in this component. It also uses this new function to build de hour label, because this label has this animation in the native implementation, as can be seen in the below visual reference:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5a63a1ee-037e-4cc1-adf9-205357dca7ee

Closes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/27515

title: [in_app_purchase] Handling "nothing to restore" with restorePurchases()
body:
I'm attempting to upgrade the `in_app_purchase` from 0.5.x to 1.0.x but it seems that the purchase restoration user flow that we are currently using on iOS is no longer achievable with the newer version of the plugin. I'd appreciate guidance on how to achieve our current functionality with `in_app_purchase` 1.0 or (alternatively) what is the recommended user experience for purchase restoration on iOS that is compatible with `in_app_purchase` 1.0.

Currently, our application works like this:
1. User taps "restore purchases" and the application starts showing a progress indicator.
2. Behind the scenses, `InAppPurchase.instance.queryPastPurchases()` is called.
3. When the call finishes, the progress indicator is hidden, and the return value is inspected.
4. If current purchases were returned: they are restored.
5. **If no current purchases were returned: a message is shown letting the user know that there was nothing to restore and suggesting making a new purchase.**

Now `queryPastPurchases()` has been removed. `restorePurchases()` can be used instead, but it doesn't return anything. So it seems the app won't be able to react when there was nothing to restore. The user won't get any feedback after tapping the button, which doesn't seem user-friendly at all. From the user's standpoint, it looks like that app just ignores the taps (because nothing happens), so it looks like the app is broken.

I'd like at least **one** of the following:
1. A way to know that nothing was restored by `restorePurchases()`
2. A way to know that there is nothing to restore, even before calling `restorePurchases()`
3. A recommendation for a different purchase restoration user experience on iOS that is at lest as user-friendly as our current one and compatible with `in_app_purchase` 1.0.
author: ludwiktrammer

title: Widget preview leaks processes  when terminated
body:
### Steps to reproduce Not sure if this is Windows specific. - Create or `cd` to a sample Flutter project - Run `flutter widget-preview start --web-server` - Wait for "Done loading previews" to appear - Press Ctrl+C to terminate the process - Repeat some number of times Here's a PowerShell script that does this in a loop 10 times: ``` for ($i = 1; $i -le 10; $i++) { $tempLog = Join-Path -Path $env:TEMP -ChildPath "flut_$i.txt" # Removed RedirectStandardError and the delay between processes $p = Start-Process -FilePath "flutter" -ArgumentList "widget-preview", "start", "--web-server" -PassThru -NoNewWindow -RedirectStandardOutput $tempLog $start = Get-Date while (-not ((Get-Content $tempLog -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue) -match "Done loading previews") -and ((Get-Date) - $start).TotalSeconds -lt 300) { Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 500 } Stop-Process -Id $p.Id -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } ``` cc @bkonyi ### Expected results No `dart` processes should be left running in the background. ### Actual results Lots of `dart`, `dartaotruntime` and `dartvm` processes are left running (some of these are DevTools and DTD). ### Code sample N/A ### Screenshots or Video ### Logs No useful output is collected (even in with `-v`) when pressing Ctrl+C: ``` [ ] <- accept [ ] Caching compiled dill [ +23 ms] lib\main.dart is being served at http://localhost:53696 [ ] The web-server device requires the Dart Debug Chrome extension for debugging. title: Cannot sign in with google with unverified scopes on Android
body:
When adding restricted scopes to unverified oauth, google sign in loads forever on Android.  Works in iOS. 

Steps to reproduce: 
1) Add unverified restricted scope in Google Console
2) Add unverified restricted scope in app
3) Sign in with Google on Android (result: loads forever)

Unverified scopes should show unverified oauth screen and allowed to proceed with sign in.
author: vanfresh

title: [google_sign_in] Can't sign in to youtube channels?
body:
<!-- You must include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

I'm trying to login with youtube channels (not just the Google account itself.) 

on the console, I've added auth/youtube to the OAuth screen (not sure if this is needed)


I've also added this to my scopes 

`GoogleSignIn googleSignIn = GoogleSignIn(
    scopes: [
      'email',
      'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube', // Youtube scope
    ],
  );`

(I'm also using FirebaseUser to capture emails, not sure if this is possible to interlace?)

When I try to log in it shows me my e-mails and when selected it gives me a screen if I want to accept "project......" (not sure how to change this to the name app btw) to manage my youtube channels and whatnot. however when I press yes, it doesn't show me the channel list so I can select the one I want. So I don't really have access to the user channel stuff like playlists, name, memberships and subscriptions, image, etc... how could I fix this?

Here are the screens I DO get

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47351773/86461014-48bae600-bd21-11ea-92ca-95d62905f9e1.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47351773/86461071-583a2f00-bd21-11ea-9d38-b1595cade8fd.png)

also here's my sign in code

````
class AuthService {
  String OAuthClientId = '*hidden but came from the dev console*'; //Don't use this for nothing?
  String discoveryDocs = 'https://www.googleapis.com/discovery/v1/apis/youtube/v3/rest';
  String scopes = 'http://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube.readonly';

  final FirebaseAuth auth = FirebaseAuth.instance;
  GoogleSignIn googleSignIn = GoogleSignIn(
    scopes: [
      'email',
      'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/youtube', // Youtube scope
    ],
  );
```

  Future<FirebaseUser> login() async {
    final GoogleSignInAccount googleSignInAccount = await googleSignIn.signIn();
    final GoogleSignInAuthentication googleSignInAuthentication = await googleSignInAccount.authentication;

    final AuthCredential credential = GoogleAuthProvider.getCredential(
      accessToken: googleSignInAuthentication.accessToken,
      idToken: googleSignInAuthentication.idToken,
    );
    // You'll need this token to call the Youtube API. It expires every 30 minutes.
    final token = googleSignInAuthentication.accessToken;

    final AuthResult authResult = await auth.signInWithCredential(credential);
    final FirebaseUser user = authResult.user;
    assert(!user.isAnonymous);
    assert(await user.getIdToken() != null);

    final FirebaseUser currentUser = await auth.currentUser();
    assert(user.uid == currentUser.uid);

    return currentUser; }`

title: Password manager autofill does not work on web
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create project using steps described in [flutter's codelab](https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/flutter-codelab-first#2).
2. Add an `AutofillGroup` with 2 `TextField`s (a `Form` with `TextFormField`s has the same behavior)
3. Run the project in Chrome
4. Attempt to use a password manager to autofill the inputs

**I've included a sample repo**: https://github.com/timmywil/flutter_test_autofill

### Expected results

Fields should be filled in when selecting credentials.

### Actual results

Fields are not filled in. Nothing happens.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
AutofillGroup(
  child: Column(
    mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
    spacing: 16.0,
    children: [
      TextField(
        autofillHints: const [AutofillHints.username, AutofillHints.email],
        autofocus: true,
        decoration: const InputDecoration(
          border: OutlineInputBorder(),
          labelText: 'Email',
        ),
      ),
      TextField(
        autofillHints: const [AutofillHints.password],
        decoration: const InputDecoration(
          border: OutlineInputBorder(),
          labelText: 'Password',
        ),
        obscureText: true,
      ),
    ],
  ),
),
```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

Below are example behaviors for Bitwarden and Proton Pass. Selecting credentials in either does not fill in the fields.

**Bitwarden**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9b46363c-4187-4b38-a296-cbfced2a994b

*Note that moving the mouse is required to get the dropdown to show*

**Proton Pass**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9fd917e1-1461-4621-98e4-2510909a59be

*Also note there is no value for autofillHints on the email field that brings up the login credentials rather than the email generator.*

</details>

```console
N/A

</details>

## Command

flutter build ipa -t lib/main_dev.dart --flavor=dev
```

## Steps to Reproduce
1. ...
2. ...
3. ...

## Logs

title: Flutter web: 'CompilationError' while debugging makes debugging any `async` function very challenging
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Very often, it is not possible to inspect variable values by hovering over variable names while in a Flutter web debug session. The actual variable value is not displayed as it would be expected. Instead, a tooltip displaying the type of the variable is displayed, just as if the debugger wasn't running.

1. Create a Flutter web application using flutter create, then add an `async` function somewhere. Call it from, eg., the `incrementCounter()` implementation. Just print something out in this async function.
2. Place a breakpoint on the `print` line and start debugging
3. When you reach your breakpoint, try hovering a member variable name in the source code.




### Expected results

The variable value should be displayed.

### Actual results

The value of the variable is not displayed.

When the problem occurs, if you type the variable name in the debug console, you will see:

```
> image
CompilationError: The getter 'image' isn't defined for the class 'XXXPageState'.
 - 'XXXPageState' is from 'package:com_example_application/xxx_page.dart' ('lib/xxx_page.dart').
Try correcting the name to the name of an existing getter, or defining a getter or field named 'image'.
image
^^^^^
```

The debug console (itself) seems to work overall though:

```
> print(1234)
1234
> this
XXXPageState (XXXPageState#e5b8d)
  ... (correct output here)
```


### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

More details/discussion here: https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/5414

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots</summary>

In the screenshot below, the value of the variable should be displayed inside the tooltip window while in a debug session:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e2bb20e5-79e0-4c5b-8e78-3ef8bde68272)

In the code above, note that image does have a value - and that value should be displayed - as the line of code above the yellow indicator has (successfully) been executed.

Also, the image variable is effectively used in the code further below (not shown), and even print'ed. It is not expected to be tree-shaken.

Occasionnally, the VS console log shows:

```
ChromeProxyService: Failed to evaluate expression '': InvalidInputError: .
```
</details>


### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

```console
Nothing to show here
```

</details>


### Flutter Doctor output

<details open><summary>Doctor output</summary>

```console

title: Reimplemented StretchingOverscrollIndicator with Simulation ported from Android 12.
body:
Fixed an issue #169659

This PR improves the StretchingOverscrollIndicator to better match native Android behavior.

- Previously, the stretch effect worked well only for slow dragging, and during fast flings it was absent or felt clipped.
- Implemented a Simulation-based animation that responds naturally to both slow drags and high-velocity flings.
- The result closely resembles the native Android overscroll behavior while maintaining Flutter's performance characteristics.

This change ensures that momentum-based gestures produce a more natural and intuitive overscroll experience, especially for users accustomed to native Android scroll views.

## Fling
[fling](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3944eef3-baaa-47df-82ca-9c49d4283fe4)

## Pull And Reduce
Also, a very similar animation is implemented when pulling as well.

[pull](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a3025dc-0996-403d-b58b-d07f25487cda)

title: Add data assets
body:
Refiling of #169273 (reverted in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/170034), which is a refiling of #164094, which itself is a rebase of #159675.

This PR adds bundling support for the experimental dart data asset feature: Dart packages with hooks can now emit data assets which the flutter tool will bundle.

It relies on flutter's existing asset bundling mechanism (e.g. entries in AssetManifest.json, DevFS syncing in reload/restart, ...).

The support is added under an experimental flag (similar to the existing native assets experimental flag).

Also, kNativeAssets is removed to also bundle data assets on flutter build bundle.

The chrome sandbox is disabled as per #165664.

### Steps to reproduce

Used https://github.com/MohanedZekry/flutter-go-router-example to reproduce:

1. Replace home_screen.dart:

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class HomeScreen extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomeScreen({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Center(
      child: PopupMenuButton<String>(
        icon: const Icon(Icons.menu, color: Colors.white),
        elevation: 16.0,
        shape: const RoundedRectangleBorder(
          borderRadius: BorderRadius.all(Radius.circular(4.0)),
        ),
        position: PopupMenuPosition.under,
        offset: const Offset(0, 16),
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context) {
          return [
            const PopupMenuItem<String>(
              value: 'item1',
              child: Text('Item 1'),
            ),
          ];
        },
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

2. Open PopUpMenu
3. Navigate to any BottomMenuItem (other than HOME)

### Expected results

When navigating to another tab, the popup should automatically close.

### Actual results

The popup does not close and remains visible.

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

See Above Repro Steps

### Steps to reproduce

Used https://github.com/MohanedZekry/flutter-go-router-example to reproduce:

1. Replace `home_screen.dart`:
```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

class HomeScreen extends StatelessWidget {
  const HomeScreen({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Center(
      child: PopupMenuButton<String>(
        icon: const Icon(Icons.menu, color: Colors.white),
        elevation: 16.0,
        shape: const RoundedRectangleBorder(
          borderRadius: BorderRadius.all(Radius.circular(4.0)),
        ),
        position: PopupMenuPosition.under,
        offset: const Offset(0, 16),
        itemBuilder: (BuildContext context) {
          return [
            const PopupMenuItem<String>(
              value: 'item1',
              child: Text('Item 1'),
            ),
          ];
        },
      ),
    );
  }
}
```
2. Open PopUpMenu
3. Navigate to any BottomMenuItem (other than HOME)

### Expected results

Pop up should dismiss without error
Go_Router navigation should own the WidgetTree and navigate

### Actual results

App shows red screen with following error, Go_Router navigation occurs beneath:

`════════ Exception caught by widgets library ═══════════════════════════════════
The following assertion was thrown building LayoutBuilder:
This widget has been unmounted, so the State no longer has a context (and should be considered defunct).
Consider canceling any active work during "dispose" or using the "mounted" getter to determine if the State is still active.`

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

See Above Repro Steps

</details>

author: tylerbarnesTrexis

title: Recover merged thread startup latency regression
body:
On app startup, when the work to start the engine, launch the app, and set the Dart code running is serialized on the platform thread, the time to first interactable frame takes longer. This issue tracks investigating and mitigating the regression.

b/373761573
author: zanderso

title: Make MethodChannel accessible from Isolate (forground, background services)
body:
### Use case

i'm building an app that send bulk sms's and i want to send them by segments periodically, and this can be achieved using foreground or background services and i have to use MethodChannels for that.

### Proposal

make MethodChannels from any isolate

title: Data assets
body:
Refiling of #169273, which itself is a rebase of #159675

This PR adds bundling support for the experimental dart data asset feature: Dart packages with hooks can now emit data assets which the flutter tool will bundle.

It relies on flutter's existing asset bundling mechanism (e.g. entries in AssetManifest.json, DevFS syncing in reload/restart, ...).

The support is added under an experimental flag (similar to the existing native assets experimental flag).

Also, kNativeAssets is removed to also bundle data assets on flutter build bundle.

The chrome sandbox is disabled as per #165664.

author: RobertBrunhage

title: "W/MotionEvent-JNI(11414): android_view_MotionEvent_nativeGetPointerCount: -1" warnings keep filling the terminal
body:
### Steps to reproduce

When I use a normal `GestureDetector` I get my terminal filled with warnings on the motion event, such as this:

```
W/MotionEvent-JNI(11414): android_view_MotionEvent_nativeGetPointerCount: -1
```


### Expected results

I expect the touch events of the `GestureDetector` to not trigger any warning

### Actual results

I get spammed with the following warning whenever I touch the `GestureDetector`:
```
W/MotionEvent-JNI(11414): android_view_MotionEvent_nativeGetPointerCount: -1
```

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

The code needed to reproduce this error is a simple `StatefulWidget` with a single `GestureDetector` button:
```dart
class TestGraphics extends StatefulWidget {
  const TestGraphics({super.key});

  @override
  State<TestGraphics> createState() => _TestGraphicsState();
}

class _TestGraphicsState extends State<TestGraphics> {
  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      body: Column(
        mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
        children: [
          GestureDetector(
            onTap: () {
              print("TEST");
            },
            child: Container(color: Colors.amber, width: 100, height: 100),
          ),
         ],
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

[Upload media here]

</details>


### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

```console

title: wasm build breaks cached images!
body: ### Steps to reproduce We switched our app to compile dart to wasm for higher performance which is experimental. For my colleagues it works fine. Also in same browser than mine. But for me I get this (see expected Results and Actual results): The weird thing is, it's random on which images it happens, some images sometimes show, sometimes the images in the Carousel on top are also not visible. It says this which makes no sense at all since some images show and some not and they are all webp. Yes I tested to not use default and still the same. Error message: see logs below ### Expected results ### Actual results ### Code sample I don't know what to upload here. It'sThe app is working fine except for wasm on my browser (newest chrome, newest macbook m4 Chip, also not working on edge browser. ### Screenshots or Video _No response_ ### Logs E] Image load failed Metadata: { "app_version": "Development Code Version 1.1 API Version Development 1.1", "environment": "development", "platform": "wasm", "timestamp": "2025-08-28T12:33:53.021", "image_url": " ", "effective_url": " ", "widget_location": "OptimizedImage", "is_wasm": true } ERROR: ImageCodecException: Image file format (application/octet-stream) is not supported by this browser's ImageDecoder API. title: Flutter 3.32.8 - iOS - FlutterError Exception: Image upload failed due to loss of GPU access
body:
### Steps to reproduce My Flutter version is 3.27.4, and my iOS app, developed purely for Flutter, has been in the background for extended periods of time, perhaps several hours, and then hot-started back to the foreground. ### Expected results I was hoping everything would work fine. ### Actual results However, most images loaded from Boundary appear white. My Flutter version is 3.27.4, and after upgrading to 3.32.6, the images turn purple. This issue persists. I also found output code in the Flutter source code. Is there a solution? How have other pure Flutter apps resolved this issue? The app has requested background operation. ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart FlutterError Exception: Image upload failed due to loss of GPU access ```
### Screenshots or Video
Screenshots / Video demonstration
### Logs

title: Android minSdk migration sets minSdk incorrectly in Flutter 3.35.1 for values below 24
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new flutter project with 3.35.1.
2. Change android min sdk to 23
3. Run flutter build apk --release

### Expected results

`minSdk = 23` should change to `minSdk = flutter.minSdkVersion`.

### Actual results

`minSdk = 23` changes to `minSdkVersion flutter.minSdkVersion` only when the value is below 24.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
plugins {
    id("com.android.application")
    id("kotlin-android")
    // The Flutter Gradle Plugin must be applied after the Android and Kotlin Gradle plugins.
    id("dev.flutter.flutter-gradle-plugin")
}

android {
    namespace = "com.example.myapp"
    compileSdk = flutter.compileSdkVersion
    ndkVersion = flutter.ndkVersion

    compileOptions {
        sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
        targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
    }

    kotlinOptions {
        jvmTarget = JavaVersion.VERSION_11.toString()
    }

    defaultConfig {
        // TODO: Specify your own unique Application ID (https://developer.android.com/studio/build/application-id.html).
        applicationId = "com.example.myapp"
        // You can update the following values to match your application needs.
        // For more information, see: https://flutter.dev/to/review-gradle-config.
        minSdk = 23 // This will change to minSdkVersion flutter.minSdkVersion
        targetSdk = flutter.targetSdkVersion
        versionCode = flutter.versionCode
        versionName = flutter.versionName
    }

    buildTypes {
        release {
            // TODO: Add your own signing config for the release build.
            // Signing with the debug keys for now, so `flutter run --release` works.
            signingConfig = signingConfigs.getByName("debug")
        }
    }
}

flutter {
    source = "../.."
}

```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video




### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>
https://pastebin.com/fdQss5c5

The app works fine in the browser, but this error pollutes the debug console and seems to come from the Dart/Flutter VM service

title: Fix CupertinoNavigationBar MediaQuery regression #174771
body:
## Problem

Since Flutter 3.35, `MediaQuery.of(context)` inside CupertinoNavigationBar components (trailing, leading, middle, etc.) returns `Size(0.0, 0.0)` instead of the correct screen dimensions. This regression breaks responsive logic and layout decisions made within navigation bar components.

## Root Cause

The issue occurs because CupertinoNavigationBar components wrap their child widgets with `MediaQuery` widgets that only provide `textScaler` data using `MediaQueryData(textScaler: ...)`. When creating a `MediaQueryData` with only specific properties, all other properties default to their initial values, causing `size` to default to `Size.zero`.

Affected components:
- Leading widget
- Trailing widget 
- Middle widget
- Back chevron
- Back label
- Large title
- Bottom widget

## Solution

Replace `MediaQueryData()` constructors with `MediaQuery.of(context).copyWith()` to preserve all existing MediaQuery properties (size, padding, devicePixelRatio, etc.) while only modifying the text scaling behavior.

## Changes

### Core Fix
- Modified 6 `MediaQueryData` constructor calls in `packages/flutter/lib/src/cupertino/nav_bar.dart`
- Preserves all inherited MediaQuery properties while maintaining text scaling limits
- Ensures `size`, `padding`, `devicePixelRatio` and other properties are not reset to defaults

### Testing
- Added comprehensive test suite with 3 focused test cases in `packages/flutter/test/cupertino/nav_bar_test.dart`
- Tests verify MediaQuery size preservation in trailing/leading widgets
- Regression test specifically prevents Size(0,0) from returning
- Tests are minimal and focused on the core issue

## Impact

### Fixed Issues
- ✅ MediaQuery.of(context).size returns correct screen dimensions
- ✅ MediaQuery.of(context).padding returns correct safe area padding  
- ✅ MediaQuery.of(context).devicePixelRatio returns correct pixel ratio
- ✅ Responsive navigation bar components work correctly
- ✅ No impact on existing text scaling behavior

### Compatibility
- ✅ Backward compatible - no breaking changes
- ✅ No impact on Material design widgets
- ✅ All existing CupertinoNavigationBar functionality preserved
- ✅ Performance neutral - same number of MediaQuery widgets

## Testing Instructions

To verify the fix:

```dart
CupertinoNavigationBar(
  trailing: Builder(
    builder: (context) {
      final size = MediaQuery.of(context).size;
      print('Size: $size'); // Should print actual screen size, not Size(0.0, 0.0)
      return Icon(CupertinoIcons.info);
    },
  ),
)
```

Fixes flutter/flutter#174771
author: meylis1998

title: showTimePicker overflows in TimePickerEntryMode.inputOnly during running test
body:
showTimePicker should open without layout exceptions in widget tests, just like it does in a normal app run.

Widget tests throw a RenderFlex overflow error when using TimePickerEntryMode.inputOnly.

Notes:
	•	Using TimePickerEntryMode.dial works fine in tests.

```console
The following assertion was thrown during layout:
A RenderFlex overflowed by 18 pixels on the bottom.

The overflowing RenderFlex has an orientation of Axis.vertical.
The edge of the RenderFlex that is overflowing has been marked in the rendering with a yellow and
black striped pattern. This is usually caused by the contents being too big for the RenderFlex.
Consider applying a flex factor (e.g. using an Expanded widget) to force the children of the
RenderFlex to fit within the available space instead of being sized to their natural size.
This is considered an error condition because it indicates that there is content that cannot be
seen. If the content is legitimately bigger than the available space, consider clipping it with a
ClipRect widget before putting it in the flex, or using a scrollable container rather than a Flex,
like a ListView.
The specific RenderFlex in question is: RenderFlex#82945 relayoutBoundary=up1 OVERFLOWING:
  needs compositing
  creator: Column ← _TimePickerModel ← _TimePicker ← _FormScope ← WillPopScope ←
    Form-[LabeledGlobalKey<FormState>#30b7a] ← Expanded ← Column ← ConstrainedBox ← Container ←
    AnimatedContainer ← _SingleChildViewport ← ⋯
  parentData: offset=Offset(0.0, 0.0); flex=1; fit=FlexFit.tight (can use size)
  constraints: BoxConstraints(0.0<=w<=248.0, h=120.0)
  size: Size(248.0, 120.0)
  direction: vertical
  mainAxisAlignment: start
  mainAxisSize: min
  crossAxisAlignment: center
  verticalDirection: down
  spacing: 0.0

author: Amitverma8

title: [packages] Xcode analysis failing on `stable` only
body:
In https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/171391 we had a situation where a number of analysis failures only showed up in post-submit when updating the macOS min OS version used for our deprecation detection. On further investigation, it was because the `master` test (which runs in both presubmit and postsubmit) passed, but the `stable` version of the test (which only runs in postsubmit) failed.

Maybe some auto-migration that happens on `master` invalidated the test in some way? This needs more investigation.
author: stuartmorgan-g

title: [Google3 Bug]: iOS, Images replaced with pink fill when coming out of background
body:
### Help us understand the severity of this issue

- [x] causing severe production issues e.g. malfunctions or data loss
- [ ] blocking next binary release
- [ ] blocking a client feature launch within a quarter
- [ ] nice-to-have but does not block a launch within the next quarter

### Steps to reproduce

b/408379305

This is the same issue as https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/126878. So far, we've reproduced it on iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 12 mini, not reproduced on iPhone 13 and SE. 

1. Background or kill the app
2. Trigger a notification to be sent to the app
3. Reopen the app from the notification

### Expected results

Images are displayed as usual.

### Actual results

Images are all replaced with a pink fill.

### Code sample

Not adding a minimal repro, as this bug has been previously investigated in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/126878.

### Screenshots or Video

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f5e014c0-4fc1-474a-8736-2d12ef8a029c)


### Logs

_No response_

### Flutter Doctor output

Could not reproduce in a dev environment yet.

author: alihassan143

title: Texture flickering issue when using external textures for video playback on iOS
body:
### Steps to reproduce



I encountered a texture flickering bug when using external textures for video playback on iOS platform. I've prepared a demo that consistently reproduces this issue on Flutter 3.35.1.



**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Clone the demo repository
2. Run on iOS device with Flutter 3.35.1
3. Observe texture flickering (no need to click PlayAll)



### Expected results

Video should play smoothly without texture flickering.

### Actual results

Texture flickering occurs during video playback when using external textures.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>


**Demo repository:** https://github.com/qpalwo/flutter_flash_screen

**Key changes:** https://github.com/qpalwo/flutter_flash_screen/commit/1f00260e3781119ad04bfbc6617a9b28a98af523

**Suspected root cause:**
I suspect this issue is related to PR https://github.com/flutter/engine/pull/57020. After changing `keep_alive_frame_count` to 0, the issue no longer reproduces.

**Analysis:**
Upon examining the related logic, I believe the problem may be caused by improper reuse of the RenderTargetCache during YUV to RGB conversion.
</details>


### Screenshots or Video



<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a23498b9-2de7-430d-a9e6-16af4074038b

</details>


### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

```console
[Paste your logs here]
```

</details>


### Flutter Doctor output

title: Add optional MenuController parameter to DropdownMenu
body:
### Use case

I want to be able to open/close menu of `DropdownMenu` manually.

### Proposal

Add optional `MenuController` parameter to `DropdownMenu`.  

Currently, in `DropdownMenu` state, the variable `MenuController _controller` is assigned with `MenuController()`.  
Make it `widget.menuController ?? MenuController()`.
author: AHAHACUK

title: [Cupertino] MediaQuery.of(context) returns Size(0,0) inside CupertinoNavigationBar trailing since Flutter 3.35
author: flowhorn

title: Android build fails with "Unresolved reference: Properties" in fresh project after full toolchain reinstall on macOS
body:
### Steps to reproduce

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Perform a full reinstall of Android Studio and the Android SDK on macOS.
2. Delete the global `.gradle` cache (`rm -rf ~/.gradle`).
3. Run `flutter doctor -v` to confirm a healthy environment.
4. Create a brand new, unmodified Flutter project: `flutter create my_app`.
5. Attempt to build for Android: `cd my_app` and then `flutter run`.

### Expected Results
The new, unmodified project should compile and run successfully on an Android device.

### Actual Results
The build fails with a Kotlin script compilation error in `android/settings.gradle.kts`:
`e: .../settings.gradle.kts:6:26: Unresolved reference: Properties`

---
### `flutter doctor -v` Output

author: rashedheydari2001

title: FlutterFragmentActivity destroys engine provided by provideFlutterEngine
body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run `flutter create bug`.
2. Override provideFlutterEngine and configureFlutterEngine in MainActivity (`android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/example/bug/MainActivity.kt`) to return a persistent engine (and import `android.content.Context` and `io.flutter.embedding.engine.FlutterEngine`):
    ```
    override fun provideFlutterEngine(context: Context): FlutterEngine? {
        return provideEngine(this)
    }
    override fun configureFlutterEngine(flutterEngine: FlutterEngine) {
        // do nothing, because the engine was configured in provideEngine
    }
    companion object {
        var engine: FlutterEngine? = null
        fun provideEngine(context: Context): FlutterEngine {
            val eng = engine ?: FlutterEngine(context, emptyArray(), true, false)
            engine = eng
            return eng
        }
    }
    ```
3. This works as expected. The app can be closed and opened again.
4. Now, change the base class of MainActivity from FlutterActivity to FlutterFragmentActivity.
5. Open and close the app. FlutterFragmentActivity destroys the engine on detach. Open the app again. It crashes because provideFlutterEngine provided a destroyed engine.

As a workaround, I created a subclass of FlutterEngine with an overridden, empty destroy method.

using the controls here:

Please CC jimgraham@google.com,kjlubick@google.com on the revert to ensure that a human
is aware of the problem.

To file a bug in Skia: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/skia/issues/entry
To file a bug in Flutter: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new/choose

To report a problem with the AutoRoller itself, please file a bug:

author: chunhtai

title: selectableDayPredicate in DatePicker with EntryMode.input unexpectedly gets executed again after DatePicker already returned a date
body:
## Steps to Reproduce (tested on Android and Web)

1. Execute `flutter run` on the code sample
2. Press the FloatingActionButton
3. Press OK on the DatePickerDialog which is in Input Mode

**Expected results:**
Just like in EntryMode.calendar no Exception will be thrown because selectableDayPredicate is not run after the Dialog returned a value.

**Actual results:** 
Exception is thrown because selectableDayPredicate is run once AFTER the Dialog in EntryMode.input returns the selected date

<details>
<summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({Key? key}) : super(key: key);

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        primarySwatch: Colors.blue,
      ),
      home: const MyHomePage(title: 'Flutter Demo Home Page'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({Key? key, required this.title}) : super(key: key);

  final String title;

  @override
  State<MyHomePage> createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State<MyHomePage> {
  DateTime? dateTime;

  void _changeDate() {
    dateTime = null;
    showDatePicker(
        context: context,
        initialDate: DateTime.now(),
        firstDate: DateTime.now().subtract(const Duration(days: 10)),
        lastDate: DateTime.now(),
        initialEntryMode: DatePickerEntryMode.input,
        selectableDayPredicate: (date) {
          if (dateTime == null) {
            print("$date is selectable");
            return true;
          }
          if (DateUtils.dateOnly(dateTime!) == date) {
            print("$date is NOT selectable");
            return false;
          }
          print("$date is selectable");
          return true;
        }).then((value) {
      setState(() {
        dateTime = value;
        print("#showDatePicker() returned with $dateTime");
      });
    });
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title),
      ),
      body: Center(
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
          children: <Widget>[
            const Text(
              'selectedDate:',
            ),
            Text(
              '$dateTime',
              style: Theme.of(context).textTheme.headline4,
            ),
          ],
        ),
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: _changeDate,
        tooltip: 'change Date',
        child: const Icon(Icons.edit_calendar),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Logs</summary>

author: math1man

title: Allow running tests repeatedly to reproduce flakiness
body:
In some cases it is necessary to run tests repeatedly to reproduce flakiness. To achieve this, few changes are needed:
- Disable automatic device reboot logic (otherwise it interrupts the test run)
- Document instructions how to locally run tests repeatedly

author: jahnli

title: Sibling apps from a pub workspace raise each other dependencies from plugins used in only one
body:
### Steps to reproduce

We could only repro this on `3.32.8` and not at `3.35.1`. We are simply opening this issue so that if the Android team wants to revisit this and add some tests to make sure this fix wasn't accidental. We could not find any related issues so this is why we are opening this one.

1. Clone https://github.com/FMorschel/flutter_workspace
This project is a pub workspace with two `flutter create -e <project>` projects, and one of them has a dependency, but the other does not.
See that `two` has a dependency on `wearable_buttons` plugin (but any plugin where the `minSDK` or `ndkVersion` or similar is higher than the Flutter default will have the same problem).
2. Run `two` on an Android device/emulator and see that everything works fine
3. Try to run `one` on an Android device/emulator and see that it also warns about `ndkVersion` and `minSDK`, but it has no dependency on that plugin.

We have a similar case in our company. The problem is that we actually have a pub workspace with our own packages and six apps. Only one of our apps requires the use of a plugin with a higher `minSDK`. Our other apps need to upgrade these values even though they are not using those packages.

We are using pub workspace to simplify our dependency management and improve our IDE performance, but this bug prevents us from doing so.

### Expected results

I expected to be able to run either app, as the repro above is.

### Actual results

While `two` does run (because it has the dependencies we have manually increased the above-discussed values), `one` doesn't.

### Code sample

Clone from above.


### Screenshots or Video

Not relevant.


### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs from `one`</summary>

```console
Resolving dependencies in `D:\dev\flutter\workspace`...

  meta 1.16.0 (1.17.0 available)
  test_api 0.7.4 (0.7.7 available)
  vector_math 2.1.4 (2.2.0 available)
  vm_service 15.0.0 (15.0.2 available)
Got dependencies in `D:\dev\flutter\workspace`!
11 packages have newer versions incompatible with dependency constraints.
Try `flutter pub outdated` for more information.
Launching lib\main.dart on SM G780F in debug mode...
Your project is configured with Android NDK 26.3.11579264, but the following plugin(s) depend on a different Android NDK version:
- wearable_buttons requires Android NDK 27.0.12077973
Fix this issue by using the highest Android NDK version (they are backward compatible).
Add the following to D:\dev\flutter\workspace\one\android\app\build.gradle.kts:

    android {
        ndkVersion = "27.0.12077973"
        ...
    }
Application finished.

Exited (-1).
```

title: Fix: Added accessibility announcements to SnackBars. Fixes issue [#173065]
body:
<!--
Thanks for filing a pull request!
Reviewers are typically assigned within a week of filing a request.
To learn more about code review, see our documentation on Tree Hygiene: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/main/docs/contributing/Tree-hygiene.md
-->

Fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/173065

### What was changed:
- **Added accessibility announcements** to SnackBar content. Now, when a SnackBar appears, its content will be announced for screen reader users using `SemanticsService`.

### Why this is important:
- **Accessibility**: Ensures users with visual impairments can hear SnackBar content, enhancing the user experience for a broader audience.

### Related Issue:
- Fixes issue [#173065](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/173065) regarding accessibility for SnackBars.

author: PeacefulBlack

title: [BUG] SafeArea and MediaQuery Fail to Handle Insets on Android 9/10 with Keyboard, targetSdkVersion 35
body:
### Steps to reproduce

**Steps to Reproduce**

Create a new Flutter project with targetSdkVersion and compileSdkVersion set to 35 in android/app/build.gradle.

Use the provided minimal code example, which includes a Scaffold with SafeArea wrapping a TextField and prints MediaQuery padding values.'

Run the app on an Android 9 (API 28) or Android 10 (API 29) emulator or device (e.g., Pixel 3 XL emulator with notch enabled).

Tap the TextField to open the keyboard.

**Observe the following:**

Widgets are obscured by the keyboard (e.g., TextField goes behind the keyboard).

SafeArea does not apply correct padding to avoid the status bar or navigation bar.

MediaQuery.of(context).padding.bottom and MediaQuery.of(context).padding.top return incorrect values (e.g., EdgeInsets.zero or unexpected values).



### Expected results

SafeArea should apply appropriate padding to ensure content is not obscured by the status bar, navigation bar, or keyboard.

MediaQuery.of(context).padding.top should reflect the status bar height (including notch, if present).

MediaQuery.of(context).padding.bottom should reflect the navigation bar height.

MediaQuery.of(context).viewInsets.bottom should reflect the keyboard height when the keyboard is open.

Widgets (e.g., TextField) should remain visible above the keyboard, with SafeArea adjusting the layout accordingly.



### Actual results

**On Android 9 (API 28) and Android 10 (API 29):**

SafeArea does not prevent content from being obscured by the status bar or navigation bar.

Widgets (e.g., TextField) are hidden behind the keyboard when it opens.

MediaQuery.of(context).padding.top and MediaQuery.of(context).padding.bottom often return EdgeInsets.zero or incorrect values.

MediaQuery.of(context).viewInsets.bottom does not update correctly to reflect the keyboard height (remains 0.0 or returns inconsistent values).

### Code sample

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      home: const MyHomePage(),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyHomePage({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    // Print MediaQuery padding for debugging
    print('Padding: ${MediaQuery.of(context).padding}');
    print('ViewInsets: ${MediaQuery.of(context).viewInsets}');

    return Scaffold(
      resizeToAvoidBottomInset: false, // Prevent resizing when keyboard appears
      appBar: AppBar(title: const Text('SafeArea & MediaQuery Issue')),
      body: SafeArea(
        top: true,
        bottom: true,
        child: Column(
          mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.spaceBetween,
          children: [
            const Text('This should stay visible above the keyboard'),
            TextField(
              decoration: const InputDecoration(
                border: OutlineInputBorder(),
                hintText: 'Type here',
              ),
              onChanged: (value) {
                // Rebuild to check MediaQuery updates
                print('Padding: ${MediaQuery.of(context).padding}');
                print('ViewInsets: ${MediaQuery.of(context).viewInsets}');
              },
            ),
            const Text('This should stay visible above the navigation bar'),
          ],
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}


### Screenshots or Video

<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

[Upload media here]

</details>

title: [Linux] Stuttering during window resizing
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Run a Flutter project for Linux in release or profile mode (or even debug mode, but there, stuttering would be permissible).
2. Resize the window.

### Expected results

Window is resized smoothly, just like native Gtk apps or even Electron apps

### Actual results

Very noticeable stuttering when resizing the window

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'package:flutter/material.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MainApp());
}

class MainApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MainApp({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      home: Scaffold(
        body: Center(
          child: Text('Hello World!'),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>

Stuttery Flutter window vs smooth Electron window:

_No response_

title: TabBar widget is printing debug logs in all build modes that should not appear (Android and iOS )
body:
### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a Flutter app with TabBar 2. Run `flutter run --release` 3. Observe console output showing: `I/flutter: ✅ widget.tabs[index]: Instance of 'Tab'` ### Expected results No debug logs should appear in debug and release mode. ### Actual results Debug logs appear even in debug and release builds. ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatefulWidget { const MyApp({super.key}); @override State createState() => _MyAppState(); } class _MyAppState extends State with TickerProviderStateMixin { late TabController _tabController; @override void initState() { super.initState(); _tabController = TabController(length: 3, vsync: this); } @override void dispose() { _tabController.dispose(); super.dispose(); } @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false, home: Scaffold( appBar: AppBar(title: const Text('TabBar Bug Demo')), body: Column( children: [ TabBar( controller: _tabController, tabs: const [ Tab(text: 'Tab 1'), Tab(text: 'Tab 2'), Tab(text: 'Tab 3'), ], ), Expanded( child: TabBarView( controller: _tabController, children: const [ Center(child: Text('Content 1')), Center(child: Text('Content 2')), Center(child: Text('Content 3')), ], ), ), ], ), ), ); } } ```
### Screenshots or Video
Screenshots / Video demonstration iOS: android:
### Logs

body:
### Steps to reproduce Device physical device motorola edge 50 neo (wireless) (mobile) • android-arm64 • Android 15 (API 35) Flutter Doctor ``` [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 3.29.3, on macOS 15.5 24F74 darwin-arm64 • Flutter version 3.29.3 on channel stable • Framework revision ea121f8859 • Engine revision cf56914b32 • Dart version 3.7.2 • DevTools version 2.42.3 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 34.0.0) • Platform android-35, build-tools 34.0.0 • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17.0.9+0-17.0.9b1087.7-11185874) • All Android licenses accepted. [✓] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 16.4) • Build 16F6 • CocoaPods version 1.16.2 [✓] Android Studio (version 2023.2) • Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17.0.9+0-17.0.9b1087.7-11185874) [✓] VS Code (version 1.102.2) • Flutter extension version 3.114.0 [✓] Network resources • All expected network resources are available. ``` Example code ```dart class BaseCardWidget extends StatelessWidget with GetWidth { const BaseCardWidget({ super.key, required this.image, this.margin, required this.height, required this.width, this.child, this.padding = const EdgeInsets.all(16), }); final String image; final double height; final double width; final Widget? child; final EdgeInsetsGeometry? margin; final EdgeInsetsGeometry padding; @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return SizedBox( width: width, height: height, child: Container( width: double.maxFinite, margin: margin, decoration: BoxDecoration( borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20), image: DecorationImage( colorFilter: ColorFilter.mode( Colors.black.withOpacity(0.45), BlendMode.darken, ), image: NetworkImage(image), fit: BoxFit.cover, ), ), child: Padding( padding: padding, child: Card( color: Colors.transparent, elevation: 0, shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20)), child: child, ), ), ), ); } } ``` result as below the image is upside down cases where it works "fine" ```dart decoration: BoxDecoration( borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20), image: DecorationImage( colorFilter: ColorFilter.mode( Colors.black.withOpacity(0.45), BlendMode.darken, ), image: NetworkImage(image), fit: BoxFit.fill, // fill prop do the job ), ), ``` ```dart decoration: BoxDecoration( borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20), image: DecorationImage( // if you comment the filter works fine as well // colorFilter: ColorFilter.mode( // Colors.black.withOpacity(0.45), // BlendMode.darken, // ), image: NetworkImage(image), fit: BoxFit.cover, ), ), ``` it works fine on ios physical device/simulator and android emulator ### Expected results the image is not upside down ### Actual results the image is upside down ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart class BaseCardWidget extends StatelessWidget with GetWidth { const BaseCardWidget({ super.key, required this.image, this.margin, required this.height, required this.width, this.child, this.padding = const EdgeInsets.all(16), }); final String image; final double height; final double width; final Widget? child; final EdgeInsetsGeometry? margin; final EdgeInsetsGeometry padding; @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return SizedBox( width: width, height: height, child: Container( width: double.maxFinite, margin: margin, decoration: BoxDecoration( borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20), image: DecorationImage( colorFilter: ColorFilter.mode( Colors.black.withOpacity(0.45), BlendMode.darken, ), image: NetworkImage(image), fit: BoxFit.cover, ), ), child: Padding( padding: padding, child: Card( color: Colors.transparent, elevation: 0, shape: RoundedRectangleBorder(borderRadius: BorderRadius.circular(20)), child: child, ), ), ), ); } } ```

title: Fix DropdownMenu filtering is broken
body:
## Description

This PR fixes DropdownMenu filtering.
The implementation choice is to not rely on storing the selected index and to store the selected value instead.

## Related Issue

Fixes [DropdownMenu filtering is broken](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/174609)

## Tests

Adds 1 test.

title: [webview_flutter] Crash on iOS 26 when using magnifier
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Add package dependencies:
   - `webview_flutter: ^4.13.0`
   - `webview_flutter_wkwebview: ^3.23.0`
2. Run the provided code sample on iPhone device/simulator with iOS 26
3. **Make sure the `input` is not focused**
4. Long press and hold on the text field in the web view to open the magnifier  
   - I am using https://pub.dev/ as an example but it happens on any input field
4. Release the touch
   - This will result in a crash

### Expected results

The magnifier should be dismissed.

### Actual results

App crashes.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
import 'dart:async';

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:webview_flutter/webview_flutter.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyApp({super.key});

  @override
  State<MyApp> createState() => _MyAppState();
}

class _MyAppState extends State<MyApp> {
  late final controller = WebViewController();

  @override
  void initState() {
    super.initState();
    unawaited(loadPage());
  }

  Future<void> loadPage() async {
    final uri = Uri.parse('https://pub.dev');
    await controller.loadRequest(uri);
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return MaterialApp(
      title: 'Flutter Demo',
      theme: ThemeData(
        colorScheme: ColorScheme.fromSeed(seedColor: Colors.deepPurple),
      ),
      home: Scaffold(
        body: SafeArea(
          child: WebViewWidget(
            controller: controller,
          ),
        ),
      ),
    );
  }
}
```

</details>


### Screenshots or Video

<details open>
<summary>Screenshots / Video demonstration</summary>

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/942c8b1e-7789-4112-88cb-dad8282a3ee6

</details>


### Logs

<details open><summary>Logs</summary>

Xcode console output:
```console
*** Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'CALayerInvalidGeometry', reason: 'CALayer position contains NaN: [nan 68]. Layer: <CALayer:0x600000c631b0; position = CGPoint (0 0); bounds = CGRect (0 0; 0 48); delegate = <_UIEditMenuListView: 0x10742f340; frame = (nan 0; 0 48); anchorPoint = (inf, 0); alpha = 0; layer = <CALayer: 0x600000c631b0>>; sublayers = (<CALayer: 0x600000ccd260>, <CALayer: 0x600000c5e7c0>); opaque = YES; allowsGroupOpacity = YES; anchorPoint = CGPoint (inf 0); opacity = 0>'

author: mqhamdam

title: Exceptions caught by scheduler and gesture library
body:
I was trying to run my app, and in my debug console, it kept showing this error when performing an action on my android device: 

```console
Exception caught by scheduler library ═════════════════════════════════
'package:flutter/src/rendering/mouse_tracker.dart': Failed assertion: line 200 pos 12: '!_debugDuringDeviceUpdate': is not true.


Then this also: 
The following assertion was thrown during a scheduler callback:
'package:flutter/src/rendering/mouse_tracker.dart': Failed assertion: line 200 pos 12: '!_debugDuringDeviceUpdate': is not true.

Either the assertion indicates an error in the framework itself, or we should provide substantially more information in this error message to help you determine and fix the underlying cause.

When the exception was thrown, this was the stack:
#2      MouseTracker._deviceUpdatePhase (package:flutter/src/rendering/mouse_tracker.dart:200:12)
mouse_tracker.dart:200
#3      MouseTracker.updateAllDevices (package:flutter/src/rendering/mouse_tracker.dart:367:5)
mouse_tracker.dart:367
#4      RendererBinding._scheduleMouseTrackerUpdate.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter/src/rendering/binding.dart:485:22)
binding.dart:485
#5      SchedulerBinding._invokeFrameCallback (package:flutter/src/scheduler/binding.dart:1397:15)
binding.dart:1397
#6      SchedulerBinding.handleDrawFrame (package:flutter/src/scheduler/binding.dart:1331:11)
binding.dart:1331
#7      SchedulerBinding.scheduleWarmUpFrame.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter/src/scheduler/binding.dart:1040:9)
binding.dart:1040
#8      PlatformDispatcher.scheduleWarmUpFrame.<anonymous closure> (dart:ui/platform_dispatcher.dart:837:16)
platform_dispatcher.dart:837
#12     _RawReceivePort._handleMessage (dart:isolate-patch/isolate_patch.dart:184:12)
isolate_patch.dart:184
(elided 5 frames from class _AssertionError, class _Timer, and dart:async-patch). 

Any possible fixes will be appreciated.
```
author: Devdeejay27

title: Flutter 3.32.8 init a project And flutter build apk failed Could not determine the dependencies of task ':app:compileReleaseJavaWithJavac'.
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. flutter create 
2.flutter pub get 
3. flutter build apk -v

`
plugins {
    id("dev.flutter.flutter-plugin-loader") version "1.0.0"
    id("com.android.application") version "8.7.3" apply false
    id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android") version "2.1.0" apply false
}
`



### Actual results

I created a new Flutter project and tried to run flutter build apk, but the build failed. I repeatedly executed flutter clean and ./gradlew clean, then tried flutter build apk again, but it still failed. So, I'd like to seek some help. Thank you.

title: The archive did not include a dSYM for the Flutter.framework with the UUIDs [4C4C44DF-5555-3144-A1D4-7C9DD5C9C035]. Ensure that the archive's dSYM folder includes a DWARF file for Flutter.framework with the expected UUIDs.
body:

title: [Proposal] Disable Pasting Image in textInput on HyperOS
body:
### Steps to reproduce it seems an OS-specific problem for HyperOS . HyperOS introduces automatic writing of screenshots to clipboard feature. 1、take a screenshot,and it will be copied to Clipboard automatically. 2、paste it in Textfield. Long press will not bring up the paste button, but there is a shortcut paste button on the keyboard. ### Expected results nothing happens ### Actual results garbled charaters,unusable page ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatelessWidget { const MyApp({super.key}); @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( title: 'Flutter Demo', home: Scaffold( body: Container( child: TextField( minLines: 5, maxLines: null, ), ), ), ); } } ```
### Screenshots or Video
Screenshots / Video demonstration
### Logs
Logs ```console [Paste your logs here] ```

author: Lamda303

title: Fix IconButton.color overrided by IconButtomTheme
body:
## Description

This PR fixes IconButton icon color resolution. 

## Before

The IconButton.color property does not take precedence over the ambient `IconButtonTheme`

## After

The IconButton.color property overrides the ambient `IconButtonTheme`.

## Related Issue

Fixes [SnackBar closeIconColor does not respect widget override](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/174472)
Fixes [IconButton.color is overidden by IconButtonTheme](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/174511)  

## Tests

Adds 1 test.

title: Flutter 3.35 no longer bundles assets from overridden packages
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. depend on a flutter package with assets via dependency_overrides only.
2. Attempt to use an asset from that package
3. Asset is unable to be found

This worked on previous Flutter versions, but has broken in 3.35. I believe this is related to fixes made for https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160142

### Expected results

The asset should be able to be found

### Actual results

The asset cannot be found.

title: Licenses check not failing when it's expected to fail
body:
The licenses check doesn't seem to be working (for the web engine at least). These two PRs:

- https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/174587
- https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/174588

introduced new source files.

In the past, the licenses check would've failed because we forgot to add the new files to https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/engine/src/flutter/ci/licenses_golden/licenses_flutter

title: "flutter attach" fails with "Failed to start DDS" if run before the app is up and running
body:
### Steps to reproduce

I'm trying to support auto-attaching the debugger to the emulator on Firebase Studio for a better experience. This involves running `flutter attach` for the emulator when the editor opens. However, we don't know if the app that Firebase Studio is launching is already up and running, so it's possible we will run the command while it's still launching.

`flutter attach` _appears_ to wait for the app to start, however at the last moment it throws "Failed to start Dart
Development Service" instead of attaching. Attaching a few seconds later works fine.

To repro:

- Open two terminal Windows in a Flutter project folder
- Start an Android emulator
- Run `flutter run -d emulator` in one terminal
- While the app is building, run `flutter attach -d emulator` in the other terminal




### Expected results

Flutter should attach to the device the same way it does if the command is run slightly later.

### Actual results

The `attach` command will fail:

```
Waiting for a connection from Flutter on sdk gphone64 x86 64...
Error connecting to the service protocol: failed to connect to
http://127.0.0.1:55609/ERoNfHtDZ2E=/ DartDevelopmentServiceException: Failed to start Dart
Development Service
```

However running the command again succeeds.

Note: Sometimes the `flutter run` process actually throws the error, and the `attach` version succeeds and ends up connected!

### Code sample

N/A, any Flutter app will do for testing.

### Screenshots or Video

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7021672b-0982-4992-ab83-d21763772d68

author: DanTup

title: 3-button navigation will bug on Pixel devices with reduced resolution setting and reduced font- and ui-size
body:
### Steps to reproduce Hey there, there seems to be an issue with Pixel devices on which the screen resolution can be changed (Pixel 6 Pro, 7 Pro, 8 Pro, 9 Pro) and when having set the font and general screen scaling to lowest, while also using the old 3-button-navigation, not the gesture-navigation. I got a report and screenshots from a Pixel 7 Pro user and am able to reproduce this issue with a Pixel 9 Pro, but not on the Pixel 6, presumably because it doesn't have the screen scaling setting. When changing the resolution to 'High resolution" instead of 'Full resolution', setting font and ui scale to the lowest setting and then opening up a bottom sheet with a Syncfusion Chart (https://pub.dev/packages/syncfusion_flutter_charts) in it (I'm not sure whether the bottom sheet has to feature a syncfusion chart or if it can be any bottom sheet, we have multiple bottom sheets and was only able to reproduce it on one with a syncfusion chart), closing the sheet, going to the homescreen, going back to app, will lead to the softkeys aligning to the left side of the screen. Then when going to the homescreen will cause some resolution shift shortly and then bug the keys out fully and they will move to the height of the homescreen dock, to the right. When going to the app again, the keys will move to the bottom, but still at the right and the most recent apps/docks will appear in the navigation bar (I'm fairly sure this is the tablet mode navigation bar for big screen devices). This also seems to result in other apps to be scaled wrong. It seems like the lowered resolution, together with scaling down the ui (and maybe something to do with syncfusion) will cause the phone to do wrong calculations and end up in tablet ui mode. I'm not sure if this is a fault on flutter side, our side, syncfusion side or maybe even pixel side. ### Expected results Usually the app should just be scaled according to the user settings and the ui should not switch to tablet-mode ### Actual results the system ui will switch to some sort of tablet mode ### Code sample
Code sample I may will update this later once i have a reproducible sample. ```dart [Paste your code here] ```
### Screenshots or Video
Screenshots / Video demonstration
### Logs
Logs ```console [Paste your logs here] ```
### Flutter Doctor output
Doctor output ```console [Paste your output here] ```
author: EtzBetz

title: Breaking Change Missing maintainFocusability v3.35
body:
Request to add a list item on the breaking changes for Flutter V3.35 as listed [here](https://docs.flutter.dev/release/breaking-changes)

The following item from the Flutter Changelog seems to have caused a breaking change:
Add flag to exclude focus for hidden children in Visibility, maintainFocusability. Set maintainFocusability to false in IndexedStack by @skimm3 in [159133](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/159133)

To get the same working as in previous Flutter versions you now have to manually set maintainFocusability to true. In this case the default value results in different behaviour from the previous version.

For example when using an invisible text field to allow for input being rendered in a way which TextField doesn't allow for you'd use something alike (with a way to set focus on the field):
```dart
            Visibility(
              visible: false,
              maintainState: true,
              child:TextField(/****/),
              ),
```
This used to work but now one has to add `maintainFocusability: true,` to get the same result.

It would be useful to have a mention on the breaking changes which says something alike: Visibility Widgets relying on being able to focus a child element of said widget now require the new parameter `maintainFocusability: true,` to be set.

title: TabBar accessibility labels cannot be customized - "Tab 1 of 7" automatically added
body:
### Steps to reproduce The TabBar widget automatically generates accessibility labels in the format "Tab 1 of 7" and there's no way to override or customise these labels. This creates accessibility issues when developers need specific, meaningful labels for their tabs. ## Current Behavior When using TabBar with Tab widgets, the accessibility system automatically generates labels like: "Tab 1 of 7" "Tab 2 of 7" etc. These automatic labels cannot be overridden, even when using Semantics widgets or excludeSemantics: true. ## Current Attempts to Fix 1. Wrapping Tab in Semantics: Doesn't work because TabBar overrides the semantics 2. Using excludeSemantics: Doesn't prevent TabBar's automatic labeling 3. Custom TabBar implementation: Requires rebuilding the entire TabBar functionality ## Impact Accessibility Compliance: Apps cannot meet accessibility requirements when they need specific labels User Experience: Screen readers announce confusing "Tab 1 of 7" instead of meaningful labels Development Overhead: Developers must create custom TabBar implementations Related Issues #12432: "Customize a11y for TabBars" (closed, but issue persists) PS: The suggested solution was to add a child parameter to TabBar, but this is also not working. ### Expected results Developers should be able to provide custom accessibility labels for tabs, either through: 1. A label parameter on Tab widgets 2. The ability to wrap Tab widgets in Semantics widgets 3. A callback to customize accessibility labels ### Actual results When using TabBar with Tab widgets, the accessibility system automatically generates labels like: "Tab 1 of 7" "Tab 2 of 7" etc. These automatic labels cannot be overridden, even when using Semantics widgets or excludeSemantics: true. ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart import 'package:flutter/material.dart'; void main() { runApp(const MyApp()); } class MyApp extends StatefulWidget { const MyApp({super.key}); @override State createState() => _MyAppState(); } class _MyAppState extends State with TickerProviderStateMixin { late TabController _tabController; @override void initState() { super.initState(); _tabController = TabController(length: 3, vsync: this); } @override void dispose() { _tabController.dispose(); super.dispose(); } @override Widget build(BuildContext context) { return MaterialApp( debugShowCheckedModeBanner: false, home: Scaffold( appBar: AppBar(title: const Text('TabBar Bug Demo')), body: Column( children: [ TabBar( controller: _tabController, tabs: const [ Tab(text: 'Tab 1'), Tab(text: 'Tab 2'), Tab(text: 'Tab 3'), ], ), Expanded( child: TabBarView( controller: _tabController, children: const [ Center(child: Text('Content 1')), Center(child: Text('Content 2')), Center(child: Text('Content 3')), ], ), ), ], ), ), ); } } ```
### Screenshots
Screenshots / Video demonstration
### Logs
Logs ```console [Paste your logs here] ```
### Flutter Doctor output
Doctor output ```console fvm flutter doctor -v [✓] Flutter (Channel stable, 3.32.8, on macOS 15.5 24F74 darwin-arm64, locale en-IN) [323ms] • Flutter version 3.32.8 on channel stable at /Users/nandanmagdum/fvm/versions/3.32.8 • Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git • Framework revision edada7c56e (4 weeks ago), 2025-07-25 14:08:03 +0000 • Engine revision ef0cd00091 • Dart version 3.8.1 • DevTools version 2.45.1 [✓] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 36.0.0) [879ms] • Android SDK at /Users/nandanmagdum/Library/Android/sdk • Platform android-36, build-tools 36.0.0 • ANDROID_HOME = /Users/nandanmagdum/Library/Android/sdk • ANDROID_SDK_ROOT = /Users/nandanmagdum/Library/Android/sdk • Java binary at: /opt/homebrew/opt/openjdk@17/bin/java This JDK is specified in your Flutter configuration. title: The _compareScreenOrder Problem
body:
### Steps to reproduce If there are some text boxes: When comparing the green box to the blue box using _getBoundingBox, the green box will be sorted after the blue box. This result must be wrong. Using xx.boundingBoxes.first seems to be correct. ### Expected results The blue box order is behind green box. ### Actual results The green box order is behind blue box. ### Code sample
Code sample ```dart @override Comparator get compareOrder => _compareScreenOrder; static int _compareScreenOrder(Selectable a, Selectable b) { // Attempt to sort the selectables under a [_SelectableTextContainerDelegate] // by the top left rect. final Rect rectA = MatrixUtils.transformRect(a.getTransformTo(null), a.boundingBoxes.first); final Rect rectB = MatrixUtils.transformRect(b.getTransformTo(null), b.boundingBoxes.first); final int result = _compareVertically(rectA, rectB); if (result != 0) { return result; } return _compareHorizontally(rectA, rectB); } ```
### Screenshots or Video When I was in Flutter 3.19.1, this problem occurred because `compareOrder` was not overridden in `Text`. Because of the order problem, the middle part of the copy is not highlighted.
Screenshots / Video demonstration
In the current master branch, the ` Comparator get compareOrder => _compareScreenOrder;` function in the Text class has been overwritten, so the performance is correct. However,` _getBoundingBox` is still used for comparison in `selectable_region.dart`, which has potential risks. ### Logs
Logs ```console [Paste your logs here] ```
### Flutter Doctor output Doctor output is correct.

author: dumazy

title: [Proposal] Allow the Material 3 DropdownMenu widget to disable its search field
body:
### Use case

Developers wanting to use the `DropdownMenu` but without the type-to-search of the Material 3 widget.

### Proposal

I propose that the `enableSearch` flag is also passed to the `readOnly` attribute of the underlying `TextField`. Currently it's only used for the search highlight. If we can disable the I-beam cursor and text selection, that would be good as well.

We can tweak the `effectiveMouseCursor` and the `SelectionContainer` for the text field when it does not allow searching.
author: navaronbracke

title: Flutter should support iOS 15's Secure Paste feature
body:
iOS 14 introduced a system notification when an app pasted from the pasteboard as a security feature.  In iOS 15, Apple is introducing "secure paste", which seems like it will bypass this notification when the paste is initiated by the user.

https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2021/06/apple-advances-its-privacy-leadership-with-ios-15-ipados-15-macos-monterey-and-watchos-8/
https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2021/10085/?time=360

That information about the feature is vague, but it may not be possible for Flutter to implement this, at least for the text selection menu, since Flutter doesn't use the native text selection menu.  If I'm understanding it correctly, tapping on Flutter's "paste" button will always be treated as being initiated by the app, and it will show the notification.

We may be able to support this for the keyboard by receiving whatever "user paste" event Apple creates and sending something along to the framework.

CC @jmagman

title: Release app bundle build fails with "failed to strip debug symbols from native libraries" despite correct NDK 27 version and config
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Description:
When building a Flutter Android App Bundle (.aab) for release, the build fails with the following error:

Release app bundle failed to strip debug symbols from native libraries. Please run flutter doctor and ensure that the Android toolchain does not report any issues.
libflutter.so.sym or libflutter.so.dbg not present when checking final appbundle for debug symbols.

Building APK with the same configuration succeeds without issues.

NDK version explicitly set to 27.0.12077973 in android/build.gradle.kts.

Tried debugSymbolLevel settings and packaging.jniLibs.keepDebugSymbols configurations.

flutter doctor reports no issues.

Build commands tested:

```console
flutter build apk --release --obfuscate --split-debug-info=... works

flutter build appbundle --release --obfuscate --split-debug-info=... fails with above error
```

flutter doctor -v output:

```console

[√] Connected device (4 available) [245ms]
    • SM F711B (mobile) • R5CR71KW99V • android-arm64  • Android 15 (API 35)

• No issues found!
```

Relevant build.gradle.kts snippet:

```
android {
    compileSdk = 35
    ndkVersion = "27.0.12077973"

    buildTypes {
        getByName("release") {
            isMinifyEnabled = true

                debugSymbolLevel = "FULL"
            }

        }
